text: ah hi everyone clown then he knows tano
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of the new
katy perry album
smile this is the newest full-length lp
from
pop artist katy perry which comes a few
years after the spotty and sometimes too
predictable witness in 2017
a record in perry's discography that had
its moments even if it's not looked upon
as favorably as i don't know teenage
dream now going into this new album i
wasn't really sure what to expect
katie teased the hell out of this record
with a range of singles that
spanned back to last year and hit me
with a mix of
disgust and amazement the singles also
account for just
under half the tracks of this 12 song
37 minute album her shortest project
to date then came the title announcement
with all of the
clown imagery i mean i'm not afraid of
clowns obviously
i just wasn't sure how to read into it
though all i know is that as i went into
this lp i hoped that
this would be like a concept or at least
make more sense as i listen to
all the tracks and in a way the album
does feature some strong themes that
play pretty clearly into the cover art
and
title for track after track on this lp
katie finds herself in a state of
emotional anguish confusion distress
so as a result of that we find her
penning anthems about
dancing through the pain like on teary
eyes or desperately seeking out relief
like
on cry about it later or finally
dwelling obsessively over the past
like on never really over katie is also
historically well known for her
self-empowerment jams the
rises and roars and fireworks of her
catalog
we get another dose of that here but in
this case it feels
less like this is for you and instead
this is for me because i'm going through
some troubles
this is me growing up through the cracks
right now on daisies
this is my resilience that needs a pep
talk at the moment
on resilience so there's definitely an
angle to smile but while katie seems to
get more personal on the lyrical side
simultaneously the album instrumentally
and sonically has so little going for it
this is possibly the most forgettable
set of tunes and instrumentals she's put
her name to so far
never really over with production from
zed was my favorite track going into
this lp
with its grand pre-chorus melodic yet
manic vocal lines
as well as visceral edm beats now after
having heard the album multiple times
it's still my favorite track and by a
mile which is
not a good sign especially since this
song is the opener so everything
kind of goes downhill from here there
are songs in the track list that i find
to be pretty tolerable but
still a little uninspired cry about it
later is a groovy nocturnal throbbing
piece of 80s synth pop
complete with slick and somewhat
sinister synth layers along with a
bridge that features a
dazzling guitar solo and daft punky
vocal manipulations
but there are so many artists doing the
80s throwback thing right now it might
as well
just be a current day sound whether that
be carly rae
or the new miley single or the latest
weekend album
it's kind of a stale move at this point
and i don't think katie's approach on
this particular track is all that bold
we then have teary eyes which is a
generic piece of dance pop with super
dreamy synth chords
as well as one of the most annoying
chorus lines on the entire record
just keep on dancing with those teary
eyes just keep on dancing with those
teary eyes
which at one point is redone with one of
those overblown millennial
choruses daisies is a mix of dramatic
acoustic guitar balancing and
progressively building
edm beats and synths not a terrible
perseverance anthem but is it one of
katie's best in this lane
i don't think so the following
resilience kind of scratches the same
itch but comes off more like a therapy
session than
a song plus all of the synthetic faux
orchestral staccato
instrumentation is just really tacky not
quite as tacky though as the
interpolation of
na na na na na na na na
hey goodbye
i'm not the end of the world great in
concept i appreciate the
sentiment of the song see the silver
lining in the dark clouds of your life
whatever is bothering you is not the end
of the world you can take a frown and
turn it all the way around turn it all
the way around
all the all the way around but the
delivery method just
seems off the song reads like a serious
mental health moment while sounding like
something from
i don't know the hunger games soundtrack
the title track is a nice pick-me-up in
the middle
of the record which when i first heard
it as a single
i thought it was a kind of generic piece
of 90s dance pop complete with dj cuts
and horn hits
which of course it still is but in the
context of the record it still comes out
ahead as one of the better tunes here
champagne problems if there are any
standout characteristics of this track
it might just be the slick electro
disco-infused production
then following that we have tucked which
is horrendously derivative it sounds
like a blatant combination of the
cardigan's love fool and kylie minogues
can't get you out of my head
if there ever could be such a combo then
the final leg of the record
is pretty weak in my opinion harley's in
hawaii which is one of my least favorite
katy perry
singles of all time still is though i
will say its escapism does make a bit
more sense in the context of this
somewhat sad record still doesn't change
that this is one of the
tackiest choruses and songs that katie
has done to date
writing harley's in hawaii away
why why why then the closing track what
makes a woman starts off like a very
quaint guitar ballad
lovely vocals lovely finger picking bit
of a country twist but then
instantly katie and her producers start
dropping these driving dance beats
where also subjected to lyrical potholes
such as i need tissues for my issues
and band-aids for my heart the ending of
the track is pretty abrupt too
and narratively i failed to see how the
song backs up or reinforces
anything else on the record is this
where all of these themes of unhappiness
and mental health were pointing to
a song with a very narrow view of the
mystique of womanhood
so at this point i feel pretty confident
in saying that this is
katy perry's weakest album to date
through
a pretty clear combination of weak
cliched production
a total lack of any ideas that are
exciting new
refreshing and pretty uninteresting
songwriting
feeling a strong three to a light four
on this one transition have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
